Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> besides it's actually quite cool that they seemingly have a 'fund' for user losses, the existence of that fund justifies giving your money to some other exchanges, if binance was able to collect some of it to put it into a fund, they have more than enough already üòÉ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> just sayin' üòÉ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> You always know how to lighten the mood...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> dont say the thought isnt plausible at least! üòÑ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> Not even just plausible, also very likely...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <The Doctor> would you rather not have the fund and your coins lost?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <The Doctor> I think it's wise to have it, and I appreciate the transparency.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> i generally would rather encourage people not to park their money at exchanges.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <The Doctor> that is relative. Sometime it takes a few days for a trade to get accomplished. Prices are rarely exactly at the level you would like to have them when you log in.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> Some people keep their coins on an exchange because it also stakes the coins for them... plain lazyness

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <The Doctor> and a few days may also become a few weeks. Yo wouldn't withdraw your coins during that time because you'd loose quite a bit for tx fees.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <The Doctor> on top of that you'd not be able to quickly respond when prices are changing. Good deals are also a matter of patience.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <The Doctor> so, it's easy to advise not to stash coins on an exchange, but reality looks different.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> yes. üòÉ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> let me refine the statement: "Don't leave your assets sitting at an exchange unnecessarily".

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> you cant give off control over your money (because that is what you actually do when you park it at an exchange) and expect me not to make fun about people that are actually doing it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> i am sorry, but you just cannot expect that.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> most of you guys don't trust well-established banks. but then easily trust a (mostly foreign) exchange with your money.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> ü§£

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> i'm not saying you should trust banks, just to make sure tho

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> and then another cryptopia, binance or what not gets cracked open

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> that is not fair

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <The Doctor> sure, go ahead. However, it's like an advise not to move your car through a city with heavy traffic or park in a public parking lot close to the street. You also can make fun of people doing it anyway, I just don't think it helps a lot üòâ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> oh well.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <The Doctor> just don't take that personal, I was referring to it in a more general way.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> If you're not prepared to take the risk that you're car gets damaged, it's actually sound advice

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> i'm not taking it personal. it's just that the very core reason that cracked open exchanges are always such a huge problem just stems from the fact that people put more money into exchanges than they should, were they reasonable human beings.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <The Doctor> true

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> If I had a new Ferrari, I probably wouldn't take it into a busy city and park it on the street...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> well if i posess anything that i dont want to lose, i'll treat it with care

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <The Doctor> if you live e.g. in Hong Kong, you'd have no choice. @Oink

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> that is some understanding that seemingly is lost with nowadays mankind

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> It's all about being aware of the risks and the willingness to accept the risk and the consequences.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> And if I was living on the moon I would worry more about micro-meteorites.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> now wait a second. an IT security breach isnt like a micro-meteorite on moon, watched from earth

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <The Doctor> yes, that's the point: Be aware of the risks, and do what's necessary to minimize them.
